result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan Allen Kinnett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Make Terrorist Threats, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.019(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:35 AM Defendant Ryan Allen Kinnett in court, in custody.   Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Ryan Allen Kinnett.  Attorney Jennifer Gross appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances. Plea Questionnaire submitted to Court.   State recites agreement, all parties agree.  Court reviews information filed,  DEF enters NC plea.  DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds DEF guilty.  State makes statement prior to sentencing. Court finds Victim Rights Legislation has been complied with.  Attny Otten makes statement prior to sentencing.  DEF makes statement to court.  Court has discussion with DEF.  Court accepts agreement and enters sentence.  

COURT:  withheld sentence:  3 years probation:  Complete any counseling and programming deemed appropriate by agent, and follow through. AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.  No Contact with E.A.E  dob:  7/24/2003 and M.W.F.  dob: 11/23/1958.    Fine/Costs  $654,  DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.   If revoked, 101 days jail credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:50AM Defendant Ryan Allen Kinnett appeared by video, in custody from Barron County Jail, with Attorney Alysja Otten, appearing in person. Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Atty Otten makes statement, indicates offer received, agreement reached, requests PLEAS.  Court sets PLEAS for 5/23/22 at 10:30AM.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on May 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

09:40 AM Defendant Ryan Allen Kinnett in court with attorney Alysja Otten.  Defendant Ryan Allen Kinnett in custody appears by video.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny  Otten acknowledges information, unable to review with client, but has reviewed criminal complaint and information mirrors complaint,  waives formal reading.  DEF enters NG plea.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.   Attny Otten requests status.  Court sets.  Status conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:25 AM Defendant Ryan Allen Kinnett in court with attorney Alysja Otten appears by zoom.  Defendant Ryan Allen Kinnett in custody appears by video.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared appears by video for the State of Wisconsin.    Court calls case and recites appearances.   Attny Otten indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.   State calls witness  Sawyer County Deputy Frey, sworn in by court.   State begins examination.    11:31 AM  Witness identified the DEF, court indicates the record will reflect.  State tenders witness.   11:32 AM  Cross-Examination by Attorney Otten.   Attny Otten no further questions.  11:33 AM Witness excused.   No further witness by either party.   State no argument and request for bind over.  Attny Otten makes argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  

Attny Otten filed bond motion.  Attny Otten makes argument.  State makes argument opposing bond modification.   Court makes statement.   Court denies bond motion.  Arraignment scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 4, 2022 at 11:30 am.

08:54 AM Defendant Ryan Allen Kinnett in court with attorney Alysja Otten.  Defendant Ryan Allen Kinnett in custody.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and updates address.  Attny Otten indicates unable to review criminal complaint with DEF.   Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  State indicates bond should remain in effect.  Court leaves bond in effect.   Court sets preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 11:30 am.
